etymologies: Middle English: from Old French quartier, from Latin quartarius ‘fourth part of a measure’, from quartus ‘fourth’, from quattuor ‘four’

definitions: each of four equal or corresponding parts into which something is or can be divided

examples.text: she cut each apple into quarters

shortDefinitions: each of four equal or corresponding parts into which something is or can be divided

definitions: a period of three months regarded as one fourth of a year, used especially in reference to financial transactions such as the payment of bills or a company's earnings

examples.text: the payment for each quarter's electricity is made in the next quarter

shortDefinitions: period of three months regarded as one fourth of year

definitions: a period of fifteen minutes or a point of time marking the transition from one fifteen-minute period to the next

examples.text: the baby was born at a quarter past nine

shortDefinitions: period of fifteen minutes or point of time marking transition from one fifteen-minute period to next

definitions: a coin representing 25 cents, one fourth of a US or Canadian dollar.
shortDefinitions: coin representing 25 cents, quarter of US or Canadian dollar

definitions: each of the four parts into which an animal's or bird's carcass may be divided, each including a leg or wing.
shortDefinitions: each of four parts into which animal's or bird's carcass may be divided

definitions: one fourth of a lunar month.
shortDefinitions: one fourth of lunar month

definitions: (in various sports) each of four equal periods into which a game is divided

examples.text: there were four scores in the opening quarter

shortDefinitions: (in basketball, American football, and Australian Rules) each of four equal periods into which game is divided

definitions: one of four terms into which a school or college year may be divided.
shortDefinitions: one of four terms into which school or university year may be divided

definitions: one fourth of a pound (avoirdupois, equal to 4 ounces).
shortDefinitions: one fourth of pound weight

definitions: one fourth of a hundredweight (US 25 lb or British 28 lb).
shortDefinitions: one fourth of hundredweight

definitions: a grain measure equivalent to 8 bushels.
shortDefinitions: grain measure equivalent to 8 bushels

definitions: the haunches or hindquarters of a horse
shortDefinitions: haunches or hindquarters of horse

definitions: a part of a town or city having a specific character or use

examples.text: it is a beautiful port city with a fascinating medieval quarter

shortDefinitions: part of town or city having particular character or use

definitions: the direction of one of the points of the compass, especially as a direction from which the wind blows.
shortDefinitions: direction of one of points of compass

definitions: a particular but unspecified person, group of people, or area

examples.text: we have just had help from an unexpected quarter

shortDefinitions: particular but unspecified person, group of people

definitions: either side of a ship aft of the beam

examples.text: he trained his glasses over the starboard quarter

shortDefinitions: either side of ship aft of beam

definitions: rooms or lodgings, especially those allocated to people in military or domestic service
shortDefinitions: rooms or lodgings for military or domestic staff

definitions: pity or mercy shown toward an enemy or opponent who is in one's power

examples.text: the riot squad gave no quarter

shortDefinitions: pity or mercy shown towards enemy or opponent who is in one's power

definitions: each of four or more roughly equal divisions of a shield separated by vertical and horizontal lines.
shortDefinitions: each of four or more equal divisions of shield separated by vertical and horizontal lines

definitions: a square charge which covers the top left (dexter chief) quarter of the field.
shortDefinitions: square charge which covers top left dexter chief quarter of field

definitions: divide into four equal or corresponding parts
shortDefinitions: divide into four equal or corresponding parts

definitions: cut (the body of an executed person) into four parts

examples.text: the plotters were hanged, drawn, and quartered

shortDefinitions: cut body of executed person into four parts

definitions: cut (a log) into quarters, and these into planks so as to show the grain well.
shortDefinitions: cut log into quarters, and these into planks so as to show grain well

definitions: be stationed or lodged in a specified place
shortDefinitions: be stationed or lodged in specified place

synonyms.text: put a roof over someone's head

definitions: range over or traverse (an area) in every direction

examples.text: we watched a pair of kingfishers quartering the river looking for minnows

shortDefinitions: range over or traverse area in every direction

definitions: move at an angle; go in a diagonal or zigzag direction

examples.text: his young dog quartered back and forth in quick turns

notes.text: no object, with adverbial of direction

shortDefinitions: move at angle

definitions: display (different coats of arms) in quarters of a shield, especially to show arms inherited from heiresses who have married into the bearer's family

examples.text: Edward III quartered the French royal arms with his own

shortDefinitions: display different coats of arms in quarters of shield

definitions: divide (a shield) into four or more parts by vertical and horizontal lines.
shortDefinitions: divide shield into four or more parts by vertical and horizontal lines
